alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 9:05AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Henderson, northern Warren, south central Rock Island, Mercer, southwestern Henry, northeastern Des Moines, southeastern Louisa and southern Scott Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 904 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toolesboro to near Oakville to Gladstone. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Boston and Keithsburg around 910 AM CDT. Kirkwood, Eliza, Joy, Seaton and Mannon around 915 AM CDT. Millersburg and Little York around 920 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Monmouth, Aledo, Shale City, Lake Warren, Hamlet, Burgess, Viola, Matherville, Reynolds, Boden, Taylor Ridge, Milan, Sherrard, Oak Grove, North Henderson, Cable, Rock Island, New Windsor and New Windsor. This includes Interstate 280 between mile markers 11 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
